metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0718 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Expat allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed input document, which triggers a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> tla uses system expat as of 1.3.5+dfsg-15

criterions.comment: audacity package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1ubuntu1').
firefox package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
xmlrpc-c package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
